intro: Coulteria africana, commonly known as the African coulteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in open woodlands and grasslands, often in well-drained soils. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture.
